bioghist.p: Carol E. Hoffecker is a professor of history at the University of Delaware, specializing in the history of Delaware. She received her bachelor's degree from the University, writing her senior thesis on Delaware during the War of 1812 and the siege of Lewes. She received her master's from Radcliffe College and her doctorate from Harvard in 1967. She launched her teaching career at Sweet Briar College in 1963 and later taught at Northeastern University. She returned to Delaware in 1968 as a junior resident scholar at the Hagley Museum and Library, where she began work on a history of Delaware. She came back to the University in 1970, when she became coordinator of the Hagley Graduate Program and taught courses on Delaware history and urban history. In 1973, she became a full-time faculty member. She is the author of Honest John Williams and Books, Bricks, and Bibliophiles: The University of Delaware Library.

scopecontent.p: The Carol Hoffecker papers consist of research materials related to her book, Honest John Williams. Materials include research notes, newspaper clippings, and copies of articles on Senator John J. Williams. The collection also includes photographs of the University of Delaware and research materials for Hoffecker's volume Books, Bricks, and Bibliophiles: The University of Delaware Library.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
